definition: sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: Some of these hoaxes will be put together into a pseudo-haiku news conference.
sentences.chinese: 一些恶作剧者将这些俳句拼凑成一个伪新闻发布会。

sentences.english: I'll miss it. Seems only fitting to end on a #haiku.
sentences.chinese: 看来在微博上写俳句结束是最好不过的。

sentences.english: Haiku is a kind of Japanese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 俳句是日本的一种诗歌。

sentences.english: Spend the evening writing haiku poetry.
A Haiku is a structured short Japanese poem with 17 syllables.
sentences.chinese: 俳句是以十七个音为一首的一种日本短诗。

sentences.english: The ancient form of Japanese haiku poetry influenced the imagists to focus on one simple image.
sentences.chinese: 日本俳句的格式影响了意象派诗人聚焦于于单个意象。

sentences.english: There are numerous contests for haiku , some sponsored by the about societies.
sentences.chinese: 还有很多俳句竞赛，有的是由上面这些会社举办的。

sentences.english: Here is a peculiar haiku series in three parts for you.
sentences.chinese: 下面是我写的古怪的俳句的其中三段。

definition: Kawabata Yasunari, Japanese literature Nobel laureate
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
Murasaki Shikibu (born c. 973), Japanese writer, author of "The Tale of Genji"
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
poetic form consisting of four lines of five syllables, with rhymes on first, second and fourth line
Misty Poetry, a post-Cultural Revolution poetry movement
